newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh taka closes flat, recovers early loss.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh taka closes flat, recovers early loss.

text.p: High call rates helped the Bangladesh taka recover early losses and closed steady on the interbank market on Sunday, dealers said.
The local currency was quoted weaker at 43.7500/7700 per dollar in early trade, but rebounded later amid a lack of liquidity at banks, they said.
At the close, the take was quoted at 43.7450/7550 to the dollar.
The call money was traded at 19 percent to 23 percent, against the previous 20 to 24 percent.
Call rates had risen before the market closed for the weekend on Thursday following outflow of about 800 million taka against purchases of central bank bills.
